gaia::text::SpannableString Class Reference

This is the class for text whose content is immutable but to which markup objects can be attached and detached. More...

Detailed Description

This is the class for text whose content is immutable but to which markup objects can be attached and detached.

For mutable text, see SpannableStringBuilder.

This is the class for text whose content is immutable but to which markup objects can be attached and detached.

 TextWidget tv = new TextWidget(staic_cast<Page*>this);
 SpannableString ss("SpannableString Text");
 ss.setSpan(new AlignmentSpan(AlignmentSpan::ALIGN_CENTER));
 ss.setSpan(new ForegroundColorSpan(Color::BLUE), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new BackgroundColorSpan(Color::RED), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new BulletSpan(BulletSpan::STANDARD_GAP_WIDTH, Color::GREEN), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new RelativeSizeSpan(1.6f), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new StrikethroughSpan(), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new StyleSpan(3), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new SubscriptSpan(), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new SuperscriptSpan(), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new TypefaceSpan("monospace"), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new UnderlineSpan(), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 ss.setSpan(new URLSpan("www.google.com"), 0, ss.length(), 0);
 tv->setText(ss);

or

base::Array<ObjectStyle*> gaia::text::SpannableString::getSpans ( int  start,
int  end,
const ObjectStyle::SpanType  type 
) [virtual]

Return an array of the markup objects attached to the specified slice of this CharSequence and whose type is the specified type or a subclass of it.

Specify Object.class for the type if you want all the objects regardless of type.

Implements gaia::text::Spanned.

int32_t gaia::text::SpannableString::nextSpanTransition ( int32_t  start,
int32_t  limit 
) [virtual]

Return the first offset greater than or equal to start where a markup object of class type begins or ends, or limit if there are no starts or ends greater than or equal to start but less than limit.

Specify null or Object.class for the type if you want every transition regardless of type.

Implements gaia::text::Spanned.

void gaia::text::SpannableString::removeSpan ( ObjectStyle *  what) [virtual]

Remove the specified object from the range of text to which it was attached, if any.

It is OK to remove an object that was never attached in the first place.

Implements gaia::text::Spannable.

void gaia::text::SpannableString::setSpan ( ObjectStyle *  what,
size_t  start,
size_t  end,
int32_t  flags 
) [virtual]

Attach the specified markup object to the range. 

 start ... end

of the text, or move the object to that range if it was already attached elsewhere. See Spanned for an explanation of what the flags mean. The object can be one that has meaning only within your application, or it can be one that the text system will use to affect text display or behavior. Some noteworthy ones are the subclasses of ObjectStyle and ParagraphStyle, and TextWatcher and

Implements gaia::text::Spannable.
